page.title: 20STOKE GOLDINGTON SCHOOL
page.content: The school in Stoke Goldington was built in 1837,it is a small well built little building.The main part of the building is a long and wide hall,later on,other parts of the building were built.Twenty four children attend the school,the ages range from five to eight,from the outside looking onto the building it looks like an old victorian house,from the inside it looks quite modern.Hardly any walls can be seen because of all the interesting work the children were doing.In one room there is a computer,television set and piano, the playground outside is relatively small for twenty four children,at one time there were forty four children at school.All of the children live in the picturesque village of Stoke Goldington apart from one boy who comes from the nearby village of Gayhurst. By Simon Goodman and Brett Coles.
